question.text: Pollination is essential in angiosperm plants because

options.text: it decreases the time required for fertilization
both of the male and female gametes are non-motile and they need to be brought together for fertilization
it is a time taking process

both <math><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi></mrow></mfenced><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">a</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">d</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">b</mi></mrow></mfenced></math>

solution.text: When the pollen grain is transferred from the anther to the stigma of the flower is called pollination. The male and female gametes of the angiosperms are non-motile and thus depend on the pollination process for transfer and are brought together for fertilization. For pollination, external agents like abiotic or biotic are required.
